title: no log message or error when ldap user cannot login due to not having a display name
body:
if i set an attribute to be the users display name in ```admin->ldap settings->advanced tab->user display name field``` owncloud will block any users who do not have a value for that attribute in their ldap entry. the message displayed to the user is that their log in information is incorrect. like a bad password or username.

nothing is logged in the owncloud.log file.

in my specific case, i set ```admin->ldap settings->advanced tab->user display name field``` to ```displayname```. my user could log into other services just fine, but not owncloud. i checked the logs, and a bunch of other things until i remembered changing that setting, and that not all users had that attribute yet. when i manually added the displayname attribute to his ldap entry, he was able to log in.

if a user is unable to log in due to not having a field manually overridden in the expert or advanced ldap settings, then owncloud should log why to owncloud.log or another log somewhere.
